column2: TENNESSEE DMV DRIVING TEST
Question Text
1. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
column6: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column8: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.

column4: left and right turns are not allowed.

column4: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column6: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.

column6: Allow the wheels to keep turning.

column2: 13. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column6: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column8: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.

column2: 14. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: slow down and enter the intersection.

16. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.

column2: 17. There are two traffic lanes in your direction. You are driving in the left lane and many vehicles are passing you on the right, and the driver behind you wishes to drive faster. You should:
column4: drive onto the left shoulder to let the other driver pass.
column6: move over into the right lane when safe to do so.
column8: stay in your lane and maintain your current speed.

column2: 18. There is no crosswalk and a pedestrian is crossing your lane ahead. You should:
column4: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.
column6: slow down as you pass the pedestrian.
column8: make eye contact and then pass the pedestrian.

column2: 25. Arrows on the roadway:
column8: show which lanes you must use.

column2: 26. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
